results.title: Sidney Nolan: Such Is Life
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams, William Leeson, Channel 4, Radio-Telefis Eirann (RTE), Ceidrik Heward, RM Arts and Waveband Film Productions
results.brief_description: Such is life is a biographical retrospective of Sidney Nolan’s life and work, told in a modern-day journey from Ireland to England, Hong Kong and Australia. Filmed against a background of Sidney Nolan’s past and current projects, it includes the designs for a new opera production for the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, a large graphic suite on themes relevant to Australia’s Bicentennial during 1988 and exhibitions of his new work in London and Hong Kong.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Adams, William Leeson, Channel 4, Radio-Telefis Eirann (RTE), Ceidrik Heward, RM Arts and Waveband Film Productions

results.title: Sidney Nolan, Mary Nolan: An Australian dream
results.creator_credit: Don Bennetts and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This documentary looks at the history of Australia through the work of artist Sidney Nolan. Discussed is the 18th century and the exploration of Australia by the Europeans, convict settlement, gold discovery through to multiculturalism of the 20th century. Narrated by Frederick Parslow with script written by Elwyn Lynn ‘An Australian dream’ also shows historic footage of Nolan and his exhibition at Heide Museum of Modern Art including music by Percy Grainger on piano roll courtesy of the Grainger Museum.

results.title: Side show
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Features Marcel Marceau in a pantomine of circus performers demonstrating their skills: a juggler, an acrobat, clowns pulling ropes, and a tightrope walker. From the series “The Art of silence”.

results.title: Side by side: prejudice
results.brief_description: Friction occurs between two girlfriends - one white, the other Chinese - when the white girl’s boyfriend does not invite the chinese girl to the exclusive Country Club because of her nationality. Raises issues surrounding the values of frienship, and irrational prejudices. No other credits available.

results.title: Sick: the life and death of Bob Flanagan, supermasochist (D)
results.brief_description: The title of this powerful documentary about performance artist and cystic fibrosis sufferer Bob Flanagan hits the mark on two levels. In one sense, it describes his physical condition; Flanagan suffered from the disease all his life and died from it at 43. The second, more evocative reference is to the shockingly direct sadomasochism of the artist’s performances. This is not a film for the squeamish, the prudish, or the faint-hearted. Even hardened viewers may feel disconcerted by Flanagan’s performances, which include piercing and penetrating of almost every body part by practically any sharp object. No other artist in history has examined so literally the experience of pain and the associated pleasures of sadomasochism and domination. Dick was also able to record a great deal of the last two years of Flanagan’s life, including his death, creating as comprehensive a portrait of an artist and his work as possible. (Awards: Winner of the Special Artistic Merit Award, Sundance, 1997).

results.title: Sick puppy [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Hancock, Sally Chesher and Bellwether Films
results.brief_description: A young boy’s puppy is dying. Anxious not to distress him, his father promises to take him to the circus (All New Moscow Circus) if worst comes to worst. A surprising short about mortality, parenthood and priorities. Cast includes Helen Thomson, David Woodley and Carl Snell.

results.title: Siberia: The Railway in peoples lives
results.brief_description: Relates the establishment of the railway to the economic development of Siberia. Discusses how the railway has influenced patterns of settlement and shows how it serves communities en route.

results.title: Siberia: The Land and its people
results.brief_description: Introduces Siberia and indicates the huge area it embraces. Traces the history of its growth and gives examples of the great variety of its inhabitants. Also shows the remnants of pre-revolution religion. Fom the series “Siberia: The Endless horizon”.

results.title: Siberia: the endless horizon
results.brief_description: Deals with the nomadic people of Northern Siberia and explains their dependence on the reindeer. Traces the history of these people and the steps that have been taken to integrate them into Russian life. Edited from the documentary “Siberia: the endless horizon”. Part 3: survival in a cold climate.

results.title: Siberia to the Silk Road
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger, Maynard and Grainger Maynard
results.brief_description: Only weeks before the August 1991 coup in Moscow, Australian Greg Grainger embarked upon a ten thousand kilometre odyssey across the U.S.S.R., through Siberia and Central Asia, observing the lives of people at a time of extraordinary change. We observe Russia’ first ever presidential elections, visiting a polling station as Boris Yeltsin makes his historical win. A look at the lives of ordinary people in a time of extraordinary changes. See the stunning beauty of a Siberian summer, journey thousands of kilometres on the Trans Siberian Railway, drink vodka with soldiers and travel the legendary Silk Road through Uzbekistan, visiting ancient cities such as Bukhara and Samarkand.
